oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: NBC Bandstand - 1958-12-05 - Part 3
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 3 of NBC Bandstand radio show hosted by Bert Parks, with Skitch Henderson and Dody Goodman. Originally broadcast December 5, 1958, and featuring WSM and Grand Ole Opry musicians to celebrate the 1000th Opry broadcast including announcer Dave Overton, Marvin Hughes and the WSM Orchestra, the Anita Kerr Quartet, Don Gibson, Dottie Dillard, Minnie Pearl, Faron Young, Hank Garland, and the Jordanaires. It is mentioned (in part 2) that KSTP of Minneapolis, MN is celebrating its thirtieth year as an NBC affiliate, and David Stone (former WSM announcer) is noted as the MC of KSTP's Sunset Valley Barn Dance.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Marvin Hughes; WSM Orchestra; Dody Goodman; Minnie Pearl; Hank Garland; Jordanaires
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Bert Parks talks -- Folks In The Sunny South Are Easy To Love [title unconfirmed] (Marvin Hughes and the WSM Orchestra) -- Bert Parks, Skitch Henderson, and Marvin Hughes talk -- Musterol commercial (Bert Parks) -- Comedy routine (Dody Goodman, Minnie Pearl) -- Dave Overton and Bert Parks introduce Hank Garland -- Sugarfoot Rag (Hank Garland) -- Mogen David Wine commercial -- Comedy routine (Dody Goodman, Bert Parks, Minnie Pearl) -- In That Great Gettin' Up Morning (Jordanaires) -- Bert Parks talks
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: National Broadcasting Company; WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Parks, Bert; Henderson, Skitch, 1918-2005; Goodman, Dody; Overton, Dave; Anita Kerr Quartet; Minnie Pearl; Young, Faron; Jordanaires (Musical group); Gibson, Don (Donald Eugene), 1928-2003; Dillard, Dottie; Hughes, Marvin; WSM Orchestra; Devine, Ott, 1910-1994; Stone, David P., 1901-1995; Carroll, Madeleine, 1906-1987
